p: To investigate the role of TREM1 in IPA, we compared the levels of TREM1 in BAL fluids from patients diagnosed with IPA and matched controls (non-IPA patients). A total of 98 subjects, including 50 cases of “probable” or “proven” IA according to the EORTC/MSG criteria and 48 controls with no A. fumigatus infection were included in this study ( Table 1). The distribution and comparison of BAL biomarker levels between different groups of patients are shown in Figure 1a. IPA patients showed significantly higher levels of sTREM1 than control patients. To corroborate its utility for the diagnosis of IPA, we analyzed the AUCROC for sTREM1 ( Figure 1a). sTREM1 demonstrated reasonable sensitivity and specificity (AUCROC = 0.718; 95% CI, 0.618–0.819; p = 0.002) with a cutoff level ≥ 800.8 pg/mL calculated using Youdens index.
